meanings.definition: In a way that is not able to be appreciated or valued.
meanings.sent1: The difference in taste was inappreciably small.
meanings.sent2: The music was inappreciably quiet in the background.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the coin disappear inappreciably.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness shone through even inappreciably tough times.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was inappreciably breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To a very small extent or degree.
meanings.sent1: The plant inappreciably grew taller overnight.
meanings.sent2: His interest in the subject inappreciably waned over time.
meanings.sent3: The cat inappreciably stretched its paws before napping.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in her eyes inappreciably faded as the day went on.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky inappreciably twinkled in the darkness.
